comments.content: This is hand-drawn, you can see that the characters don't match. There are tons of fonts with this look, check out [Cezanne](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/cezanne-regular/) for one.

Since Cezanne is (in my opinion) rather overused, you might consider an alternative like [P22 Dearest](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-dearest/), or [Dear Sarah](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054814/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000104) from Veer.

I'd recommend Dear Sarah because it uses a lot of OpenType features that make it look hand-drawn (if you are using an application that supports OpenType properly).   
   
 - Lex
